messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Weird Al, Donny Osmond, Palindromes
messages.msgSnippet: I finally figured that out after I pulled up the lyrics.  I tried my hardest to get my fingers to move that fast.  I ll want to do it a lot more to get it
messages.messageBody:
I finally figured that out after I pulled up the lyrics. I tried my hardest
to get my fingers to move that fast. I'll want to do it a lot more to get
it going that speed.

I didn't even pay attention to Weird Al... that's how visually funny Donny
Osmond's dancing is. When I read the lyrics though... I about blew a gasket
a few times. The green screen was the most fun for me I suppose because my
eyes don't focus on so many things.

~Katherine

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Weird Al, Donny Osmond, Palindromes
messages.msgSnippet: Ok I wanted to watch that again.  :D  Thanks for saying Donny was signing. I totally missed that so I went back to see.  I wish I knew what he was signing
messages.messageBody:
Ok I wanted to watch that again. :D Thanks for saying Donny was signing.
I totally missed that so I went back to see. I wish I knew what he was
signing while Weird Al was singing.

~Katherine

messages.subject: Weird Al, Donny Osmond, Palindromes
messages.msgSnippet: Loved the link to Donny Osmond doing his white guy dance during the entire White and Nerdy song. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GWc6QQ9JlMc&feature=related for
messages.messageBody:
Loved the link to Donny Osmond doing his white guy dance during the
entire White and Nerdy song.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GWc6QQ9JlMc&feature=related
for those of you who missed it.

Donny really brought it! Did anyone else notice him signing ROTFLOL??
(At one minute 55 seconds.)As any true Osmond Brothers fan knows, he
has older brothers who are hearing impaired. I was SO in love with
Donny when I was a youngster. (I was in love with Jay too.) Tiger
Beat posters were all over my bedroom walls.

Loved the Bob Dylan palindrome video too!! For palindrome fans, Jon
Agee writes great palindrome books, one of which is called "Go hang a
salami! I'm a lasagna hog! and other palindromes." His books are kind
of like comics, they tell the story of the palindrome. Lots of fun to
look at with the kids. One of my faves: Eva, can I stab bats in a cave?

Jen
